chargeHist.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael E. Puziewicz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michael E. Puziewicz is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Michael E. Puziewicz was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Michael E. Puziewicz was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Court strongly recommends defendant be allowed to travel out of State for work purposes.

Assessment, treatment, and counseling as recommended.
DNA sample w/ surcharge.
No objection to transfer to Clark Co.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Case called: 2:05 pm
INCLUDES 14CF851 AND 15CF202.
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Chad Minder:
Defendant appears in person and with Atty Dan Cveykus;
VRCW. Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. State moves to:
14CF851:
Ct. 1 (Strangulation and Suffocation-Domestic Abuse)>>DISMISS OUTRIGHT.
Amend Ct. 2 to Misdemeanor (Criminal Damage to Property-Domestic Abuse) pursuant to 943.01.
Ct. 3 >>Delete "Use of a Dangerous Weapon" Enhancer.

15CF202:
Ct. 1 (Intimidate Victim/Threaten Force, etc.)>>DISMISS OUTRIGHT.
Ct. 4 (Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order-Injunction)>>DRI.

COURT GRANTS ABOVE.
  
PLEA: 
14CF851:
Ct. 2 (Criminal Damage to Property-Domestic Abuse)>> NO CONTEST.
Ct. 3 (Disorderly Conduct-Domestic Abuse)>> NO CONTEST.

15CF202:
Ct. 2 (BJ-Felony)>> NO CONTEST.
Ct. 3 (BJ-Felony)>> NO CONTEST.

Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

COURT ORDERS: 
14CF851:
Ct. 2 (Criminal Damage to Property-Domestic Abuse)>> Sentence W/H- 3 Years Probation, concurrent to all cases. CONDITIONS: Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, No Contact with S.H., DNA Sample, Court Costs including DNA Surcharge and 2 Domestic Abuse Surcharges in 14CF851. No restitution is being requested. No objection for transfer to Clark County. COURT strongly recommends the Defendant being allowed to travel outside of State for Work Purposes. 

Ct. 3 (Disorderly Conduct-Domestic Abuse)>> Sentence W/H- 3 Years Probation, concurrent to all cases. CONDITIONS: Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, No Contact with S.H., DNA Sample, Court Costs including DNA Surcharge and 2 Domestic Abuse Surcharges in 14CF851. No restitution is being requested. No objection for transfer to Clark County. COURT strongly recommends the Defendant being allowed to travel outside of State for Work Purposes.
